name: Day of the Dead Sugar Skull Wallpaper - Black & Gold
description:
The elegant design of the Sugar Skull is representative of the Mexican Day of the Dead celebrations, where this folkloric skull is a ‘Memento Mori’ and has become an iconic symbol of life and death. In this unique wallpaper, the intricately illustrated skull has been given a sophisticated twist by replicating it in gold on a rich matt dark charcoal, making it a luxurious addition to any interior. Technical Information:
  • Roll size: 10m x 52cm (32.8 ft x 1.7 ft)
  • Pattern repeat: 53 cm
  • Made in the UK
  • Batch number: 280513
  • Also available in emerald & gold
Samples are available for purchase. Limit one per customer.
Disclaimer: Although we have tried our best to give the most accurate photographic representation of the wallpaper, we urge you to buy a sample to ensure you know what you are purchasing as returns will not be accepted unless the wallpaper is faulty. We are not liable for any damage or problems caused by faulty hanging. Hanging instructions are included with each purchase. It is the responsibility of the customer to have correctly measured the amount of wallpaper needed, this is not a service we offer. Ships within 5-7 days of order placement. U.S. and International orders ship via USPS Priority Mail and are insured. For other shipping inquiries, please see our FAQ section. Photography by Nathan Pask ©2013 Emily Evans for Street Anatomy

name: Day of the Dead Sugar Skull Linen Cushions
description:
A sophisticated sugar skull design on a luxurious linen cushion is the perfect pairing for a favorite sofa or armchair.
  • Filled with feather down insert
  • Black fabric on reverse with black piping edge
  • Concealed zip fastening
  • Made in the UK
Available in 2 sizes Pale Grey Sugar Skull Cushion 45 cm x 45 cm (18 in x 18 in) Dark Grey Large Sugar Skull Cushion 60 cm x 60 cm (23 in x 23 in)
Please allow 2-3 weeks for delivery from order date. U.S. and International orders ship via USPS Priority Mail and are insured. For other shipping inquiries, please see our FAQ section. Photography by Nathan Pask ©2013 Emily Evans for Street Anatomy

options.name: Pale Grey Sugar Skull 45 cm x 45 cm cushion
Dark Grey Large Sugar Skull 60 cm x 60 cm cushion

name: You Are Here Letterpress Print
description:
Display your love for that special someone by showing them exactly where they're located in your big loving anatomical heart.
  • 12” x 18” hand printed letterpress print
  • Five color hand carved lino cut
  • Hand set vintage metal type
  • Printed one color at a time in charcoal gray, pale yellow, red, blue and black
  • French 80# cover, true white
  • Created and hand printed by the fine folks at Roll and Tumble Press in Little Rock, Arkansas.
Ships in a reinforced mail tube within 3-5 days of order. ©2010 Roll&TumblePress

name: Beat Poetry
description:
Beautiful typographical heart print created by Dr. Stephen Gaeta who originated the popular diploma heart.
  • 18" x 24" on eco-friendly smooth gloss stock
  • Printed sustainably using 100% wind power, responsibly harvested paper and vegetable based printing ink
  • Text taken from Cases of the Organic Disease of the Heart, with Dissections and Some Remarks Intended to Point Out the Distinctive Symptoms of These Diseases, by John Collins Warren, 1809
Stephen's inspiration for the piece: "After spending years researching the function and dysfunction of the heart, I have a special fondness for this, my favorite organ. In this piece I've recreated the heart using the text from a seminal 1809 monograph of cardiology, in which the symptoms of 11 patients with heart disease (one of whom was the governor of Massachusetts) are described both as they presented in the doctor's office and, later, on the dissecting table."
Ships in a reinforced mail tube within 3-5 days of order. US and International orders ship via USPS First Class Mail. For other shipping inquiries, please see our FAQ section. ©2013 Stephen Gaeta for Street Anatomy

name: Chiclops Skulls by SARO
description:
A prolific Chicago street artist, SARO wants to show the world where he's from by infusing his signature cyclops skull with the iconic Chicago flag. The skull's lonely socket has been replaced with the stars of the Chicago flag in what SARO has named, the Chiclops Skull.
  • 28 1/4 X 11.5 in
  • Montana 94, Montana Hardcore spray paint and acrylic paint on wood
  • Made to order by SARO meaning every set is slightly different than pictured and one-of-a-kind
  • FREE pickup/delivery to Chicago residents
Read our interview with SARO on streetanatomy.com.
Sets take up to 2 weeks to make and will ship 2-3 weeks from order placement. U.S. orders ship via USPS Priority Mail and are insured. For other shipping inquiries, please see our FAQ section. ©2013 SARO for Street Anatomy

name: Large Histology Silk Scarf - Scalp
description:
This silk scarf features a histological slice of human scalp tissue, stained and examined with light microscopy. This section is cut through the dermis of the scalp, which contains hair follicles, sweat glands, sebaceous glands, blood vessels and lymph vessels. Hair follicles (blue and bright red circles) are observed in transverse sections on the left hand side, sebaceous glands are shown as pink masses and groups of sweat ducts are seen as patches of small dark blue circles, all of which are embedded in a matrix of blue collagen fibres. The right hand side is dominated by adipose tissue (fat), as white spaces among which are scattered hair follicles and groups of sweat glands. Did you get all that? No worries, become an expert on scalp tissue by studying as you wear it!
  • 100% pure silk
  • Made from crepe back silk satin with a machine rolled hem
  • 50 x 50 in (125 x 125 cm)
  • The image is courtesy of Spike Walker, Wellcome images
  • Also available in skin, brain, and bone tissues

Ships within 2 weeks of order placement. U.S. orders ship via USPS Priority Mail insured. International orders ship via USPS First Class Mail insured. For other shipping inquiries, please see our FAQ section. ©2013 Emily Evans for Street Anatomy. Photography by Nathan Pask.

name: Large Histology Silk Scarf - Bone
description:
This silk scarf features a histological slice of longitudinal human bone tissue. A technique called color phase microscopy captures the osteocytes (bone cells) in red, bringing vibrant color to this beautiful scarf.
  • 100% pure silk
  • Made from crepe back silk satin with a machine rolled hem
  • 50 x 50 in (125 x 125 cm)
  • The image is courtesy of Spike Walker, Wellcome images
  • Also available in skin, scalp, and brain tissues

Ships within 2 weeks of order placement. U.S. orders ship via USPS Priority Mail insured. International orders ship via USPS First Class Mail insured. For other shipping inquiries, please see our FAQ section. Photography by Nathan Pask ©2013 Emily Evans for Street Anatomy

name: Memento Mori II by Emily Evans
description:
• A3 11.7" x 16.5" Giclée print on Canson Aquarelle rag paper
  • Gorgeous print quality on artistic paper gives the print a hand drawn feel
  • Limited edition of 100
  • Signed and numbered by artist
  • Prints imported from London, UK
"Inspired by the Mexican 'Day of the Dead' celebrations, La Calavera Catrina (The Elegant Skull) was depicted by Posada as an upper class woman who was still at the mercy of death regardless of her status. This piece represents the idea of our own anatomy and mortality lying beneath the values of beauty and sexuality which bring power in modern times." - Emily Evans, medical illustrator
Ships in a reinforced mail tube within 3–5 days of order. US orders ship via USPS Priority Mail. International orders ship via USPS First Class Mail. For other shipping inquiries, please see our FAQ section. ©2013 Emily Evans for Street Anatomy

name: ORGAN DONOR Vinyl Figure
description:
"Organ Donors is a vinyl figure concept that I really fell in love with because the idea actually came to me when a member of my wife's family had to have a double lung transplant. He has had Cystic Fibrosis since the day he was born and he was lucky enough to get a set of lungs from a marathon triathlete. This miracle was the seed for the Organ Donors concept." —David Foox, artist
  • Height 3.25"
  • Collect all 9 organs! Some more rare than others (Black Market Kidneys, Pickled Liver, etc)
  • Order includes 1 vinyl figure in an unopened Blind Box.
All ORGAN DONORS come individually boxed in a blind box concept - meaning, it is a surprise as to which ORGAN DONOR you will receive. Blink boxes are not returnable once they have been opened.
Ships within 3-5 days of order via USPS First Class Mail. For other shipping inquires, please see our FAQ section. ©2012 David Foox for Street Anatomy

name: Day of the Dead Sugar Skull Gold Screen Print
description:
Created in celebration of the Day of the Dead tradition, this colorful sugar skull print, designed by London-based medical illustrator Emily Evans, is printed with shining gold ink. A beautifully friendly skull for summer!
  • A2 23.4 x 16.6 in
  • Gold, hot pink, and peacock green ink on 325g Fabriano 5 paper
  • Limited edition of 20 prints, signed and numbered

Ships in a reinforced mail tube within 3–5 days of order. US orders ship via USPS Priority Mail and are insured. International orders ship via USPS First Class Mail. For other shipping inquiries, please see our FAQ section. ©2013 Emily Evans for Street Anatomy

name: Large Histology Silk Scarf - Brain
description:
This silk scarf features a silver-stained histological slice of human brain tissue, the transverse section of human cerebellum to be exact. The large root-like structures are actually Purkinje cells, some of the largest in the human brain.
  • 100% pure silk
  • Made from crepe back silk satin with a machine rolled hem
  • 50 x 50 in (125 x 125 cm)
  • The image is courtesy of Spike Walker, Wellcome images
  • Also available in skin, scalp, and bone tissues

Ships within 2 weeks of order placement. U.S. orders ship via USPS Priority Mail insured. International orders ship via USPS First Class Mail insured. For other shipping inquiries, please see our FAQ section. ©2013 Emily Evans for Street Anatomy. Photography by Nathan Pask.

name: Large Histology Silk Scarf - Skin
description:
Oh you like my skin? Why thank you, it's pure silk! This scarf features a histological slice of human skin tissue. Stained and examined using light microscopy, this image of the dermis layer of skin shows beautiful pink fibroblasts and thick collagen bundles (connective tissue).
  • 100% pure silk
  • Made from crepe back silk satin with a machine rolled hem
  • 50 x 50 in (125 x 125 cm)
  • The image is courtesy of Spike Walker, Wellcome images
  • Also available in brain, scalp, and bone tissues

Ships within 2 weeks of order placement. U.S. orders ship via USPS Priority Mail insured. International orders ship via USPS First Class Mail insured. For other shipping inquiries, please see our FAQ section. ©2013 Emily Evans for Street Anatomy. Photography by Nathan Pask.

name: Histology Silk Handkerchiefs - Rectum
description:
This silk handkerchief features a histological slice of human rectum, stained and examined with light microscopy. The image shows a transverse section of rectum with groups of mucus-secreting 'goblet' cells (blue) surrounding a central duct, making for a fine ass scarf and conversation piece!
  • 100% pure silk
  • Made from silk twill with a machine rolled hem
  • The image is courtesy of LabGeek
  • Also available in cat testicle, bone, fingernail, and cartilage
Available in two sizes:
  • Handkerchief/pocket square 14 x 14 in (35 x 35 xm)
  • Headscarf 20 x 20 in (50 x 50 cm)

Ships within 2 weeks of order placement. U.S. orders ship via USPS Priority Mail insured. International orders ship via USPS First Class Mail insured. For other shipping inquiries, please see our FAQ section. ©2013 Emily Evans for Street Anatomy. Photography by Nathan Pask.

options.name: Handkerchief/Pocket square 14 x 14 in (35 x 35 cm)

name: Histology Silk Handkerchiefs - Cat Testicle
description:
This silk handkerchief features a histological slice of cat epididymis (testicle) tissue, stained and examined with light microscopy. Perfect for your cat or a cat loving human!
  • 100% pure silk
  • Handkerchief/pocket square 14 x 14 in (35 x 35 xm)
  • Made from silk twill with a machine rolled hem
  • The image is courtesy of LabGeek
  • Also available in rectum, bone, fingernail, and cartilage

Ships within 2 weeks of order placement. U.S. orders ship via USPS Priority Mail insured. International orders ship via USPS First Class Mail insured. For other shipping inquiries, please see our FAQ section. ©2013 Emily Evans for Street Anatomy. Photography by Nathan Pask.

name: Histology Silk Handkerchiefs - Bone
description:
This silk handkerchief features a histological slice of human bone tissue, stained and examined with light microscopy. The image shows the process of endochondrial ossification (formation of bone) where cartilage cells (light blue) calcify to form newly formed bone (dark blue) and bone marrow (purple).
  • 100% pure silk
  • Made from silk twill with a machine rolled hem
  • The image is courtesy of LabGeek
  • Also available in rectum, cat testicle, fingernail, and cartilage
Available in two sizes:
  • Handkerchief/pocket square 14 x 14 in (35 x 35 xm)
  • Headscarf 20 x 20 in (50 x 50 cm)

Ships within 2 weeks of order placement. U.S. orders ship via USPS Priority Mail insured. International orders ship via USPS First Class Mail insured. For other shipping inquiries, please see our FAQ section. ©2013 Emily Evans for Street Anatomy. Photography by Nathan Pask.

name: Histology Silk Handkerchiefs - Fingernail
description:
This silk handkerchief features a histological slice of human fingernail bed tissue, stained and examined with light microscopy creating a truly vibrant scarf.
  • 100% pure silk
  • Made from silk twill with a machine rolled hem
  • Also available in rectum, bone, cat testicle, and cartilage
Available in two sizes:
  • Handkerchief/pocket square 14 x 14 in (35 x 35 xm)

name: Histology Silk Handkerchiefs - Cartilage
description:
This silk handkerchief features a histological slice of human cartilage tissue from the ear, stained and examined with light microscopy. The image shows elastic cartilage in the center (purple) surrounded by a network of collagen and elastin fibers (pink).
  • 100% pure silk
  • Made from silk twill with a machine rolled hem
  • The image is courtesy of LabGeek
  • Also available in rectum, bone, fingernail, and cat testicle
Available in two sizes:
  • Handkerchief/pocket square 14 x 14 in (35 x 35 xm)
  • Headscarf 20 x 20 in (50 x 50 cm)

Ships within 2 weeks of order placement. U.S. orders ship via USPS Priority Mail insured. International orders ship via USPS First Class Mail insured. For other shipping inquiries, please see our FAQ section. ©2013 Emily Evans for Street Anatomy. Photography by Nathan Pask.

name: Reflection of Beauty Gold Screen Print by Emily Evans
description:
A reflection of a gorgeous woman revealing the beauty on and beneath the surface. Illustrated and screen printed in shimmering gold ink in London by medical artist, Emily Evans.
  • 23.4 x 16.6 in
  • Gold ink on 270gsm white paper
  • Gold ink reflects light brilliantly making this a truly dynamic piece
  • Limited edition of 25 prints, signed and numbered

Ships in a reinforced mail tube within 3–5 days of order. US orders ship via USPS Priority Mail and are insured. International orders ship via USPS First Class Mail. For other shipping inquiries, please see our FAQ section. ©2012 Emily Evans for Street Anatomy

name: Histology Dessert Plates
description:
Oh you like my dessert plate? It’s a beautiful pattern you say? It just so happens to be from a testicle specimen! Created using scans of real human tissues, these English bone china histology dessert plates are 8" diameter and available in 4 different human tissue designs:
  • Testicle
  • Liver
  • Thyroid
  • Esophagus
Medical illustrator and artist, Emily Evans, made these gorgeous plates from original slides of various human tissues. The perfect and unique gift for the doctor, nurse, pathologist, medical professional or student in your life! Each plate is handmade in the UK.
U.S. and Canada orders ship via USPS Priority Mail and are insured. International orders ship USPS Priority Mail and cannot be insured. ©2013 Emily Evans for Street Anatomy
Is the plate you want sold out? Sign up for the mailing list to be notified when we restock the plates!

name: Airway
description:
Beautiful typographical lung print created by Dr. Stephen Gaeta who originated the popular diploma heart.
  • 18" x 24" on eco-friendly smooth gloss stock
  • Printed sustainably using 100% wind power, responsibly harvested paper and vegetable based printing ink
  • The text is from the 1628 treatise Exercitatio Anatomica de Motu Cordis et Sanguinis in Animalibus (An Anatomical Exercise on the Motion of the Heart and Blood in Living Beings) by William Harvey, in which he first postulates the circulation of blood from the right side of the heart through the lungs into the left heart before perfusing the rest of the body.

Ships in a reinforced mail tube within 3-5 days of order. US and International orders ship via USPS First Class Mail. For other shipping inquiries, please see our FAQ section. ©2013 Stephen Gaeta for Street Anatomy

name: Veronica (Piece of Mind) by Danny Quirk
description:
Another fabulous piece in Danny Quirk's Anatomical Self Dissections series. We see Veronica splitting herself open with a paint brush to reveal a superbly detailed sagittal section.
  • 11" x 14" digital print
  • Limited edition of 25
  • Signed and numbered by artist
  • Created from original watercolor painting for Dissecting Art, Intersecting Anatomy Gallery Show, March 2013, Chicago
About the Artist Danny Quirk is a recent graduate of Pratt Institute and has already had numerous showings across the continental US. He has accrued a giant fan base via his numerous features on art and fan blogs. With a close eye for detail, dexterity with watercolors, and different ways of seeing, he is able to create cutting edge anatomical work, that is rich in emotion and intrigue. Danny is truly a rising star in the anatomical art world.
Ships in a reinforced mail tube within 3–5 days of order. US and International orders ship via USPS First Class Mail with tracking. For other shipping inquiries, please see our FAQ section. ©2013 Danny Quirk for Street Anatomy

name: Soy + Saludable by Giselle Vitali
description:
• 9.375" x 12" Giclée print on Hahnemühle Photorag 308 with 1/2" border
  • Gorgeous print quality on artistic paper gives the print a hand painted feel
  • Signed by artist
Giselle Vitali's expressive take on medical illustration began in Caracas, Venezuela, where she studied illustration at the Design Institute of Caracas. Afterwards, Giselle moved to Barcelona to complete postgraduate work in illustration and a Master’s in 3D illustration/animation. Her passion continues to be pushing human anatomy to the boundaries of surrealism while keeping the sense of the anatomical intact. Her work was featured in Dissecting Art, Intersecting Anatomy co-curated by Vanessa Ruiz of Street Anatomy and Phillip Schalekamp of Squid3.
Ships in a reinforced mail tube within 3–5 days of order. US and International orders ship via USPS First Class Mail. For other shipping inquiries, please see our FAQ section. ©2013 Giselle Vitali for Street Anatomy

description:
• 9.375" x 12" Giclée print on Hahnemühle Photorag 308 with 1/2" border
  • Gorgeous print quality on artistic paper gives the print a hand painted feel
  • Signed by artist
Giselle Vitali's expressive take on medical illustration began in Caracas, Venezuela, where she studied illustration at the Design Institute of Caracas. Afterwards, Giselle moved to Barcelona to complete postgraduate work in illustration and a Master’s in 3D illustration/animation. name: Street Anatomy Sticker Packs
description:
Show your love for Street Anatomy with this pack of striking stickers featuring our street art heart logo and more. These stellar sticker packs are hand cut and include:
  • 6 Street Anatomy branded vinyl stickers
  • 1 Rx Skull vinyl sticker
  • 1 Street Anatomy card
Each pack includes a variety of stickers and colorways. No two packs are the same! Sizes of stickers range from 3" - 6" in length. Manufactured by hand on the streets of Portland, Oregon by street artist, Rx Skulls.
Ships in a small envelope within 3-5 days of order. International orders may take 6-14 days to arrive. For other shipping inquires, please see our FAQ section. ©2012 Rx Skulls for Street Anatomy

name: Edible Amore Eternal Card
description:
Give that special person an opportunity to digest your loving words with this edible card complete with an edible ink pen. They will EAT IT UP. Designed in the style of Mexican papel picado, the front features an Amore Eternal (Eternal Love) banner and two loving skulls facing a beautiful anatomical heart.
  • Includes 1 edible card, 1 edible ink pen, and 1 inedible envelope
  • 5 7/8" x 8 1/8" folded, 11 3/4" x 8 1/8" open
  • Blank inside
Illustration by medical artist Emily Evans. Handmade in London by Tasha Marks of Animal Mineral Vegetable. Ingredients: Potato starch, vegetable oil, water, E120.

Ships in a padded envelope within 3-5 days of order. International orders may take 6-14 days to arrive. For other shipping inquires, please see our FAQ section. ©2013 Emily Evans for Street Anatomy

name: Anatomy03_Quain by Alvaro Hidalgo
description:
Chilean illustrator, Alvaro Tapia Hidalgo, breathes colorful new life into classic anatomical illustrations from the 1700s and 1800s. This dramatic piece is a reinterpretation from English anatomist Richard Quain's book The anatomy of the arteries of the human body, with its applications to pathology and operative surgery (1844).
  • 16.5" x 23.375" Giclée print on Canson Etching Rag 310 gsm
  • Gorgeous print quality on artistic paper gives the print a hand painted feel
  • Signed by artist
  • Prints imported from Viña del Mar, Chile
Please allow 2-3 weeks for delivery after order date. U.S. and Canada orders ship via USPS Priority Mail and are insured. International orders ship USPS Priority Mail and cannot be insured. For other shipping inquiries, please see our FAQ section. ©Alvaro Tapia HidalgoAlvaro Tapia Hidalgo for Street Anatomy

name: Anatomy04_Gautier by Alvaro Hidalgo
description:
Chilean illustrator, Alvaro Tapia Hidalgo, breathes colorful new life into classic anatomical illustrations from the 1700s and 1800s. This dramatic piece is a reinterpretation from French anatomical painter and engraver Jacques Fabien Gautier d'Agoty's book Myologie complette en couleur et grandeur naturelle (1746).
  • 16.5" x 23.375" Giclée print on Canson Etching Rag 310 gsm
  • Gorgeous print quality on artistic paper gives the print a hand painted feel

name: Individuus Design Object Heart Key Chain
description:
Barcelona based medical illustrator, Giselle Vitali hand sculpted these hearts based on her illustration of an iconically shaped anatomical heart. Always wanting to take one of her illustrations and turn it into a 3D piece, the Heart Individuus Design Objects were born.
  • Can be used as a key chain or decoration for a bag
  • 2" x 2" x 1", length of key chain cord - 5.5"
  • Entirely handmade in Barcelona by Giselle Vitali
  • Each heart has a unique Lot and Product number
  • Available in 3 colorways: Red, Turquoise, and Charcoal
Giselle is a young Venezuelan Illustrator currently living in Barcelona, Spain. Aside from creating the more traditional medical illustrations, Giselle pushes anatomy into a more expressive art.
Ships in a padded secure mailer within 3-5 days of order. For other shipping inquiries, please see our FAQ section. ©Giselle Vitali for Street Anatomy

name: Looking Glass Language
description:
• 18" x 18" 2 color screen print on black 20 lb lightweight fibrous paper
  • Signed and numbered
  • Limited edition of 30
This gorgeously detailed screen print, titled "Looking Glass Language," is by the prolific female street artist N.O. Bonzo. She is a superb talent and is known for her intricately inked wheatpastes that often include a tantalizing female figure punctuated with anatomy. About N.O. Bonzo "Fascinated by the works of Situationists and similar anti-art movements, N.O. Bonzo uses street art as a way to actively interact and modify pyschogeographical constructs. Best known for oversized handpainted wheatpastes, she also works in multi-layer screen printed posters, adhesives, and a variety of installation techniques. Traveling and exhibiting coast to coast inside and outside, N.O. Bonzo is currently based on the West Coast."
Ships in a reinforced mail tube within 3–5 days of order. US and International orders ship via USPS First Class Mail with tracking. For other shipping inquiries, please see our FAQ section. ©2011 N.O. Bonzo for Street Anatomy

name: Street Skull by Vanessa Ruiz
description:
• 2011
  • Giclée print on archival matte paper
  • Limited edition of 50
  • Signed and numbered
  • 18” x 24”
As a trained medical illustrator, Vanessa Ruiz encompasses the perfect balance of scientific analysis with creative execution. Obsessed with the beauty and intrigue of human anatomy Vanessa founded Street Anatomy in 2007 to showcase how anatomy is visualized in art, design, and pop culture through a visual blog, gallery shows, and gallery store. Anatomical illustration and medical imaging are breaking out of the confines of the medical world and are being used by artists and designers to bring a human and emotional element to their art—as well as a touch of memento mori.
Ships in a reinforced mail tube within 3–5 days of order. US orders ship via USPS Priority Mail. International orders ship via USPS First Class Mail. For other shipping inquiries, please see our FAQ section. ©2013 Vanessa Ruiz, founder of Street Anatomy

name: The Visible Skull by Noah Scalin
description:
• 2011
  • Giclée print on archival matte paper
  • 18” x 24”
Noah Scalin, co-curator of FACE OFF: Skull-A-Day vs Street Anatomy, is an American artist, known for his creation of the award winning Skull-A-Day art project weblog. He runs the socially conscious design and consulting firm Another Limited Rebellion (ALR Design) in Richmond, Virginia. Noah is the author of several books on creativity, art, and design.
Ships in a reinforced mail tube within 5-10 days of order. US orders ship via USPS Priority Mail. International orders ship via USPS First Class Mail. For other shipping inquiries, please see our FAQ section. ©2013 Noah Scalin for Street Anatomy.

name: Viscerocranium by Tom French
description:
• 2011
  • Giclée print on archival matte paper
  • 19.75” x 27.5”
Tom French is from Newcastle upon Tyne, England. "His works are predominantly figurative. He carefully combines detailed photorealism with strong elements of abstraction and surrealism, focusing on the reflection of the conscious and subconscious mind. French's work often treads the fine line between the beautiful and unsettling, combining technically tight, classical charcoal drawings with carefree, loose and ostensibly unfinished abstract forms. By fusing the technical with lively abstraction French brings life and movement to his compositions. His work seamlessly merges the use of academic tradition with contemporary urban realism."
Ships in a reinforced mail tube within 3–5 days of order. US orders ship via USPS Priority Mail. International orders ship via USPS First Class Mail. For other shipping inquiries, please see our FAQ section. ©2013 Tom French for Street Anatomy and Skull-A-Day.

name: Pink & Smoking by Rob Tarbell
description:
• 2013
  • Giclée print on archival matte paper
  • 16” x 20”
Virginia-based artist Rob Tarbell creates art by capturing smoke on paper. The result is a beauty that is transcendently eerie in nature. “During the process, credit cards, grocery cards, gift cards, photos, and 35mm slides of my artwork are burned to remove their growing presence in daily life, an ironic nod to a self-help technique of burning sentimental things to remove their emotional burden.”
Ships in a reinforced mail tube within 3–5 days of order. US orders ship via USPS Priority Mail. International orders ship via USPS First Class Mail. For other shipping inquiries, please see our FAQ section. ©2013 Rob Tarbell for Street Anatomy and Skull-A-Day.

name: Untitled Skull Study 2 by Dan Springer
description:
• 2013
  • Giclée print on archival matte paper
  • 18” x 18”
Toronto artist, Dan Springer, aka Skulluxe, draws a lot of skulls. His quirky cartoon style makes us giggle at the memento mori symbolism of the skull.
Ships in a reinforced mail tube within 3–5 days of order. US and International orders ship via USPS First Class Mail. For other shipping inquiries, please see our FAQ section. ©Dan Springer for Street Anatomy and Skull-A-Day 2013.

name: I Cried 77 Times When You Died by Mike Egan
description:
• 2013
  • Giclée print on archival matte paper
  • 11” x 15”
Mike Egan, is a Pittsburgh based artist who has spent time working as an embalmer in funeral homes. His paintings are made using acrylic paint, shellac, wood and nails and tell stories about death, devils and saints. “I’m greatly influenced by The Day of the Dead, Halloween, horror films, churches, The German Expressionists and my time in funeral homes.”
Ships in a reinforced mail tube within 3–5 days of order. US orders ship via USPS Priority Mail. International orders ship via USPS First Class Mail. For other shipping inquiries, please see our FAQ section. ©2013 Mike Egan for Street Anatomy and Skull-A-Day.

name: Pomponia Imperatoria by Meyoko
description:
• 2011
  • Giclée print on archival matte paper
  • Certificate of authenticity signed by artist
  • 19.75” x 27.5”
Berlin-based Melissa Murillo, aka Meyoko, creates beautifully intricate illustrations in an Art Nouveau style created entirely with a fountain pen, Black China ink and more recently Gold. “Meyoko fearlessly attempts to dissect the depths of human nature itself and she does it with surgical precision.”
Ships in a reinforced mail tube within 3–5 days of order. US orders ship via USPS Priority Mail. International orders ship via USPS First Class Mail. For other shipping inquiries, please see our FAQ section. ©2013 Meyoko for Street Anatomy and Skull-A-Day.

name: Crania Anatomica Filigre Urbano
description:
• 2013
  • Giclée print on archival matte paper
  • 30” x 20”
Chicago-based artist, sculptor, scribbler, and much more, Joshua Harker is considered a pioneer & visionary in 3D printed art & sculpture. His 3D Crania Anatomica Filigre skull sculpture became the 3rd largest funded Arts project on Kickstarter back in 2011. Since then he’s been creating the unmakeable in 3D.
Ships in a reinforced mail tube within 3–5 days of order. US orders ship via USPS Priority Mail. International orders ship via USPS First Class Mail. For other shipping inquiries, please see our FAQ section. ©2013 Joshua Harker for Street Anatomy and Skull-A-Day.

name: Arrex Teef Skull by Rx Skulls
description:
• 2013
  • Giclée print on archival matte paper
  • Certificate of authenticity signed by artist
  • 12” x 18”
RX Skulls (or Arrex) is from Portland, OR. He is a street artist, who uses a skull to represent himself. He uses a multi-step process to turn his skull sketches into screen printed stickers, which he uses for his street art.
Ships in a reinforced mail tube within 3–5 days of order. US and International orders ship via USPS First Class Mail. For other shipping inquiries, please see our FAQ section. ©2013 Rx Skulls for Street Anatomy and Skull-A-Day.

name: Skull Shine by Nicolas Obery
description:
• 2012
  • Giclée print on archival matte paper
  • Certificate of authenticity signed by artist
  • 15.75” x 23.5”
Nicolas Obery is from Paris, France. His digital monochromatic and high contrast work used fine details and and hazy smoke to create fantasy images. His work features a wide range of subject matter, but of course our favorites are his skulls.
Ships in a reinforced mail tube within 3–5 days of order. US orders ship via USPS Priority Mail. International orders ship via USPS First Class Mail. For other shipping inquiries, please see our FAQ section. ©2013 Nicolas Obery for Street Anatomy and Skull-A-Day.

name: Skull 2 by Ali Gulec
description:
• 2011
  • Giclée print on archival matte paper
  • Certificate of authenticity signed by artist
  • 16” x 20”
Ali Gulec is from Istanbul, Turkey. His skulls are all experiments in design. His most outstanding artwork are the skulls. He combines various elements to form stunning skulls. His work is a modern take on surrealism and pop art.
Ships in a reinforced mail tube within 3–5 days of order. US orders ship via USPS Priority Mail. International orders ship via USPS First Class Mail. For other shipping inquiries, please see our FAQ section. ©2013 Ali Gulec for Street Anatomy and Skull-A-Day.

name: Skull Brain by Emilio Garcia
description:
• 2013
  • Giclée print on archival matte paper
  • Certificate of authenticity signed by artist
  • 12” x 18”
Emilio Garcia is from Barcelona, Spain. "Emilio, concerned with the digitalization of our society, saw his culture moving slowly away from the tangible. As reaction to this, he left his multimedia career and embraced the tactile. Drawn to the fascination of plastic, he started a new stage with the Secret Lapo Laboratories, a space for plastic experimentation, where he can give capacity to his artistic restlessness, far away from bits, clicks, databases and scripts. Out of this desire to make form with his own hands, the Jumping Brain viral was born. As his first independent project, the Jumping Brain has become an overnight sensation."
Ships in a reinforced mail tube within 3–5 days of order. US and International orders ship via USPS First Class Mail. For other shipping inquiries, please see our FAQ section. ©2013 Emilio Garcia for Street Anatomy and Skull-A-Day.

name: Natural Processes by Billy Reynolds
description:
LA based artist, Billy Reynolds, creates anatomically inspired subjects that “captivate, by reverberating between the familiar and the odd, between the beautiful and the perverse." Reynolds uses himself as a living model in everyday situations which gives him a sense of connection to humanness while exposing a sense of alienation and anxiety. His goal is to show anatomy as a living aesthetically pleasing thing and to show the optimism of being alive in our own complex state of being.
  • 12" x 15" Giclée print on Hahnemühle Photorag 308 with 1/2" border
  • Gorgeous print quality on artistic paper gives the print a hand painted feel
  • Certificate of Authenticity signed and numbered by artist

Ships in a reinforced mail tube within 3–5 days of order. US orders and International orders ship insured via USPS First Class Mail. For other shipping inquiries, please see our FAQ section. ©2013 Billy Reynolds for Street Anatomy

name: Organ Donor Key Chains
description:
Limited edition mini Organ Donor key chains by artist David Foox, creator of the original Organ Donor Vinyl toys. The little organ heads light up when a cell phone rings or texts!
  • 2" tall figures
  • 2" lanyard with metal clasp included
  • Organ heads available in brain, eyeball, kidney, lungs, heart, and stomach
  • Clear clamshell packaging
Please choose an organ from the list below before adding a quantity to your cart. Please view our FAQ section for shipping information. ©2012 David Foox for Street Anatomy

name: SARO Cyclops Skulls T-Shirt
description:
Inspired by the oddities at the famous Mütter Museum in Philadelphia, SARO's signature cyclops skulls are now available in t-shirt form. Blow away those ubiquitous skull shirts and show your pride for the one-socketed skull.
  • 2 color screen print on soft Fruit of the Loom 50/50 shirts
  • 100% cotton, preshrunk
  • T-shirt color: black
  • Unisex shirt sizes only.
  • Available in small, medium, and large - for reference, in the photo to the left, Adam (6'4") is wearing a large and Vanessa is (5'5") wearing a small
Read our interview with SARO on streetanatomy.com. Ships in a well secured padded envelope within 3-5 days of order. ©2011 SARO for Street Anatomy

name: Reactant
description:
Typographical reactant beaker created by Dr. Stephen Gaeta who originated the popular diploma heart.
  • 11" x 17" on eco-friendly thick matte stock
  • Printed sustainably using 100% wind power, responsibly harvested paper and vegetable based printing ink
  • Text taken from The Sceptical Chymist, by Robert Boyle. 1661
Stephen's inspiration for the piece: "Science isn't usually like in the movies- bubbling flasks of glowing liquids- but it sometimes is, and I think those times should be celebrated. The text of this piece comes from the work that provided the foundations of modern chemistry, in which Robert Boyle was the first to prove that matter is comprised of individual atoms." Ships in a reinforced mail tube within 3-5 days of order. International orders take 5-10 days to arrive. Please note: Some international orders may be held in customs and will take longer to arrive according to country. ©2011 Stephen Gaeta for Street Anatomy

name: Extra-Ocular
description:
Highly detailed typographical eye anatomy print created by Dr. Stephen Gaeta who originated the popular diploma heart.
  • 11" x 11" on eco-friendly thick matte stock
  • Printed sustainably using 100% wind power, responsibly harvested paper and vegetable based printing ink
  • Text taken from The Motions of the Retina Demonstrated by Experiments, from Zoonomia, by Erasmus Darwin. 1794.
Stephen's inspiration for the piece: "I find the eye to be beautifully and deceptively simple. In this piece I wanted to construct the simplicity of its anatomy with the complexity of its physiology using the text from an early, seminal work of science, Zoonomia. It is the masterpiece of Erasmus Darwin (grandfather of Charles), in which he attempted to catalog and explain human anatomy, pathology, and physiology, including our visual system." Ships in a reinforced mail tube within 3-5 days of order. International orders take 5-10 days to arrive. Please note: Some international orders may be held in customs and will take longer to arrive according to country. ©2011 Stephen Gaeta for Street Anatomy

name: Transgenic
description:
Lab mouse and DNA typographical print created by Dr. Stephen Gaeta who originated the popular diploma heart.
  • 17" x 11" on eco-friendly thick matte stock
  • Printed sustainably using 100% wind power, responsibly harvested paper and vegetable based printing ink
  • Text taken from Chromosome 1 of the Human Genome Project
Stephen's inspiration for the piece: "My inspiration for this piece came from admiration of nature's ability to create the complexity of a creature using only a simple 4 letter code. Just as we engineer the genes of mice to better model human disease, it seemed only appropriate for me to construct my own mouse from the sequence of the human genome." Ships in a reinforced mail tube within 3-5 days of order. International orders take 5-10 days to arrive. Please note: Some international orders may be held in customs and will take longer to arrive according to country. ©2011 Stephen Gaeta for Street Anatomy

name: Science Typography Pack of 4 Prints
description:
All 4 typographical science prints created by Dr. Stephen Gaeta who originated the popular diploma heart. Print pack includes :
  • Beat Poetry 18" x 24"
  • Extra Ocular 11" x 11"
  • Reactant 11" x 17"
  • Transgenic 17" x 11"
  • All printed on eco-friendly thick matte stock
  • Printed sustainably using 100% wind power, responsibly harvested paper and vegetable based printing ink
Prints ship in a reinforced mail tube within 3-5 days of order. ©2011 Stephen Gaeta for Street Anatomy

name: FACE OFF: Skull-A-Day vs Street Anatomy Gallery Show Poster
description:
The stunning gallery show poster for FACE OFF: Skull-A-Day vs Street Anatomy where Skull-A-Day and Street Anatomy join forces to bring together the greatest collection of skull art to celebrate the 3rd Annual Skull Appreciation Day!
  • 11 x 17 in high quality digital print
  • Extra thick 100# gloss paper
  • Featuring skull halves created by the co-curators, Noah Scalin and Vanessa Ruiz
  • Signed by Noah and Vanessa

Ships in a reinforced mail tube within 3–5 days of order. For other shipping inquiries, please see our FAQ section. ©2013 designed by Noah Scalin
FACE OFF: Skull-A-Day vs Street Anatomy May 31 - August 25, 2013 Opening reception: Friday, May 31  5–9 PM International Museum of Surgical Science 1524 N. Lake Shore Drive  Chicago, IL Featuring: Mike Egan, Tom French, Emilio Garcia, Ali Gulec, Joshua Harker, Meyoko, Nicholas Obery, Rx Skulls, Dan Springer, Rob Tarbell

name: OBJECTIFY THIS Exhibition Poster
description:
Beautifully designed poster for Street Anatomy's 2012 exhibition, OBJECTIFY THIS: Female Anatomy Dissected and Displayed. Featuring Fernando Vicente's American Housewife, one of 6 of his pieces featured in the exhibition, along with 8 other US and international artists. 11 x 17 in high quality digital print on extra Thick 100# gloss text, designed by the curator, Vanessa Ruiz. View photos of the OBJECTIFY THIS opening night via Flickr.
Ships in a reinforced mail tube within 3–5 days of order. For other shipping inquiries, please see our FAQ section. ©2012 designed by Vanessa Ruiz

name: Street Anatomy Gallery Show Poster
description: Limited edition run of the poster for the first Street Anatomy Gallery Show. Only 100 available. 11 in x 17 in high quality digital print on semi-gloss poster stock, designed and signed by the curator, Vanessa Ruiz. Ships in a reinforced mail tube within 3-5 days of order. International orders take 5-10 days to arrive. Please note: Some international orders may be held in customs and will take longer to arrive according to country. Click here to see a larger preview ©2010 Vanessa Ruiz

categories.name: Gallery Shows - Street Anatomy Group Show 2010

name: Closer
description:
• A3 11.7" x 16.5"
  • Printed on 270 gsm Matt Litho Realistic paper with a smooth chalk-like feel
  • Signed by artist
  • Limited edition of 20 prints
CLOSER is a heartwarming print by the artsy duo behind London-based, Mr Four Fingers. Heartwarming, of course, for those of us who are true lovers of anatomy in art. The Mr Four Fingers mission statement: "We love, share and create. We are a collaboration of two restless and exploratory minds and Mr Four Fingers is our representative. Together we share ideas and art in the hope to infiltrate every home in the world."
Ships in a reinforced mail tube within 3-5 days of order. For other shipping inquires, please see our FAQ section. ©2012 Mr. Four Fingers for Street Anatomy

name: United Skull of America II
description: 9'x9' laser cut wood on black painted square, 2010. One of the most talked about pieces in the Street Anatomy gallery show. Perfect for a large loft space or entranceway and a definite conversation starter. Artist: Noah Scalin Noah Scalin is a Richmond, Virginia based artist/designer/author/activist. He is the creator of the famous Skull-a-Day project/blog that has chronicled the creation of skulls made out of any material possible, including the United States of America. Noah's art has been exhibited internationally in museums and galleries and is currently on display at the prestigious Mütter Museum in Philadelphia. Anatomical inspiration: "Understanding how amazingly complicated we are and appreciating how tenuous our existence really is, gives me a much greater appreciation of life." Free delivery and installation for the Chicagoland area.

categories.name: Gallery Shows - Street Anatomy Group Show 2010

name: SAMPLES of Day of the Dead Sugar Skull Wallpaper
description:
8.5" x 11" sample of the Day of the Dead Sugar Skull Wallpaper, available in black & gold or emerald & gold. In this unique wallpaper, the intricately illustrated sugar skull has been given a sophisticated twist by replicating it in gold on a rich matt dark charcoal and peacock, making it a luxurious addition to any interior. Please note: Each sample varies depending on where it was cut. We guarantee that you will get a portion of a skull but may not have a full skull on your sample. Limit of one of each color per customer. If you require more for any reason, please email me directly: vanessa@streetanatomy.com
Ships in a stay flat envelope within 3–5 days of order. US and International orders ship via USPS First Class Mail. For other shipping inquiries, please see our FAQ section. ©2013 Emily Evans for Street Anatomy
